events.message: Filed a claim after my car was rear-ended at a traffic light. The damage to the rear bumper and trunk is quite extensive.
Claim has been categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the accident description and damage photos submitted.
An insurance agent has been assigned to handle the claim and will be acting as the point of contact throughout the process.
Claim acknowledgement sent to the customer confirming receipt and outlining expected timelines for processing.
Request for additional documents has been sent, including the police accident report, repair estimates, and photographs of the vehicle damage.
All requested documents have been submitted by the customer, including the police report and photos showing the damage clearly.
Investigation into the accident circumstances has commenced, focusing on verifying fault and assessing repair costs.
Investigation is complete with findings supporting the claim. Fault was determined to be the other driverâ€™s negligence.
A settlement offer has been proposed to cover the full cost of the vehicle repairs based on the approved estimate.
Customer feedback received indicating satisfaction with the settlement offer and the support provided during the process.
The claim has been officially approved by the claims department, authorizing payment for repairs.
Payment for the approved amount has been issued and processed to the customer's repair shop account.
The claim case has been closed following confirmation that repairs were completed successfully and payment was made.
All claim documents and communications have been archived for record-keeping and future reference.
